Articles.Content: 4059.1: The SKP Foundation constructs Containment Sites worldwide and keeps various items of insanity-causing powers locked in them. Most breaches of Kontainment are caught quickly, but one particularly nasty outbreak of SKP-217 (a mysterious virus that converts kerbals' flesh into rocket parts) fails to be rekontained after an incident involving an ornery molten salt reactor and a very powerful carbon dioxide laser. Within a month, an XK-class End-Of-The-World scenario is in full swing, and most of the Kerbal population has been converted to evil rocket cyborg kerbals. trochee fixation, anyone? In a surprise display, the Global Occult Koalition tries to salvage the situation with six strategically-placed keostationary railguns, but it's already too late- the SKP-217-infected kerbals have already launched into orbit and overtaken the keostationary satellite ring. The remaining living Kerbals on the SKP Foundation's orbiting facilities manage to escape to a large inertial-fusion-powered transit vehicle still untouched by the cyborg kerbals, board it, and start burning for Laythe. There, perhaps, they can find a way to salvage the kerbal race.

4060: While aboard the ship, a team of scientists begin working on Glitch Theory, which will attempt to explain the anomalies and perhaps find a way to restore the universe to its original, bug-free state.

4062: The ship arrives at Laythe and bases are set up. Colony status: Approx. 1,000 Survivors

4063: the kerbal kolony allies with the nearby KIONICLE tribes

4064: research gains a boost thanks to KIONICLE knowledge of this kind of thing

4064.1: Second fails to discover any habitable planets in the Labker-10A system, although a particularly rich source of Karbonite is discovered on Labker-10A 1. Second deploys an orbiting probe, but it is unable to land and gather surface data due to the thick coma of gaseous Karbonite surrounding the planet.

4065: Kerbals learn from the KIONICLE that space exploration in the Jool system has been prohibitively difficult of late due to what is dubbed the "Great Space Beast." Most of the Kerbals dismiss this as a myth, but it hits close to home for the descendants of the First crew and the crews of several ships that have historically been lost to mysterious forces in the darkness. A flock of robotic probes is launched into various orbits around Jool to investigate and search for anomalies.
4065.6: all probes return a 404: Anomaly not found, try again later?
4066: KIONICLES, being immune to SKP-217, send 6 men (kaller, kuparu, congu, kali, keweki, and k-someone else) to admisiter experimental cures

4065.6: Suddenly, six of the probes crash headlong into Bop, despite their orbits being far too low for that to have occurred. Before the others can give chase, their signals are lost.

4065.7: A large, invisible mass is detected approaching Kerbin.

NO GOING BACK IN TIME

anyway, 4067: experimental cure administration begins

You ninja'd me!

4067: The KIONICLES's cure fails. Furthermore, they discover that they are not, in fact, immune to SKP-217, and begin turning evil and growing rocket appendages. The Global Occult Koalition's last remaining orbital railgun in the Joolian system recognizes them as threats and begins attacking them.
4068: KIONICLES are discovered to be allergic to karbonite. only sometimes though.....
4069: Apperantly out of nowhere Mr.Walrus (the real one) appears in the Kolar system, the real one is about the size of Duna

4070: Progress in Glitch Theory allows the kerbals to develop an advanced device and patch the walrus bug.

Seriously though guys, can't we try to keep it a little bit realistic? Wasn't this the problem with the old thread, stuff kept spawning out of nowhere?

4071: The SKP Foundation discovers an object known as a 'quicksave.' They enact what is codenamed "Contingency F9-Hold", ultimately resetting the universe 41 years back in time, just after Caroline Kerman turned up missing in the Kerberture Laboratories karbonite mine, and long before mysterious mods took over the solar system.

4071.1 (occupying timeline segment analogous to 4030): A mysterious object is detected approaching the edges of the Kuiper Belt. A high-speed nuclear-powered probe is launched to rendezvous with it.

4073: The probe arrives. The object is an asteroid with abnormally high radiation levels coming from inside. The asteroid is captured and rerouted to Kerbin for further testing after a 5-year return trip.

4078:KIONICLES turn up from another system anyway.

4078.5:mr walrus (the real one) is apparently part of the universe like the KIONICLES.
4709: The K.R.A.P (Kerbal rebublc astronomy pavilion) opens up with it's first exibhit, some ancient fragments of some clay tablets written by Kerbal Polo
4709.3: K.R.A.P discovers the tablets are just a recipe for chicken noodle soup
4710: mr walrus leads 78 KIONICLES riding gigantic tigers into a portal to kerbal history 1. they fail and pop out in 5000 (remember that date so we can post this when we get there!)
4710.001: KIONICLES misread the display, they popped out in 500000. So we now get a break from them.
4710.001 the KIONICLES tigers and mr walrus are rescued by KIONICLES using the k-mask of time

4711 the KIONICLES suddenly dissappeared. *inserts laughter*

I think it is time!

Kerbal history 3!

Close this thread due to new thread with updated rules.

Edited September 26, 2014 by Joshwoo69

Hmmm, Joshwoo might be right, i'll start a poll to see what everybody wants.

Oh, and I'll take care of Kerbal history 3

Edited September 27, 2014 by MrWalrus123

Moar kionicles

- - - Updated - - -

one of the KH3 rules if you make it should be no detetong KIONICLES

4715: Nothing has happened for a while...

4716: At the Laythe colony, Glitch Theory is about halfway complete. Kerbals now have devices that are able to reduce the effectiveness of mods and glitches, at least to some extent. Glitch Theory is still classified.

4717:the researchers into glitch theory are disbanded following the arrival of non-mod KIONICLES from another solar system and the return of mr walrus and the fact that the SKP Quicksave has cleared up the mods anyway.

4718:the laythe coloy is discovrd to be a glitch and shut down.

4719:k-syndrome has evolved out of the test samples kept and has kescpae kand kinfecte the kopulation
